resources.string: Flashlight sends SOS in Morse code
Flashlight flickers going on/off the network
Flashlight flickers on reaching altitude threshold
Flashlight flickers on reaching battery power threshold
Flashlight flickers on reaching timer threshold
Your review will be posted to the Google Play store
Care to share more about it?
Personalize Features specs below\naccording to the defined Ranges.
Flickering time on Battery level reached
Flickering time on Altitude height reached
You may find below full description\nof each Feature, button\'s functionality and usage.
Click to turn On and Off the phone\'s flashlight.\nYou can also Press+Hold and Release the button to turn the flashlight On and Off as well on demand.

Phone\'s battery power shall be monitored and you will get notified by flashlight flickering when the power level you \'ve specified is reached.\n\nWhen that happens, the flashlight will flicker for 15 seconds (default), unless you deactivate the feature.
Battery power level specified has been reached. Flashlight will be flickering for 15seconds, unless you deactivate the feature.
Feature has given no permissions by User.

Set exactly after how much time you want to get notified by flashlight flickering.\n\nWhen time is reached, the flashlight will flicker for 15 seconds (default) and the button shall change to the checked one.
Time specified has come. Flashlight will be flickering for 15seconds, unless you deactivate the feature.
By enabling this feature, the SOS message in Morse code is transmitted continuously from your flashlight.\n\nClick again to stop the transmission.

You can turn On and Off the flashlight by producing short sounds, e.g. by finger snapping.

Note that you can configure the sound sensitivity in the Settings view at the desired level.

Feature is only available if you permit Audio rights to @Flashii. If otherwise, the deactivated button is displayed instead.
Feature cannot function on this Device.

By enabling this feature you will get notified by flashlight flickering when an incoming SMS reaches your phone.

Flickering and feature will stop (and button will return to it's initial view) automatically after 15 seconds.

Note that the default flickering time of 15s can be configured in the Settings view.

When Feature is enabled (green bright button) you can click to disable it.

Feature is only available if you permit SMS rights to @Flashii. If otherwise, the deactivated button is displayed instead.

By enabling this feature you will get notified by flashlight flickering when an incoming Call reaches your phone.

Flickering and feature will stop (and button will return to it's initial view) if you answer or reject the incoming Call, or automatically after 15 seconds.

Note that the default flickering time of 15s can be configured in the Settings view.

When Feature is enabled (green bright button) you can click to disable it.

Feature is only available if you permit Call rights to @Flashii. If otherwise, the deactivated button is displayed instead.

You can turn On and Off the flashlight by tilting the phone at around 90 degrees angles (from its standpoint).

Note that you can configure the angle's sensitivity in the Settings view.

Feature is only available if your phone device has a Rotation Sensor available. If otherwise, the deactivated button is displayed instead.

Flashlight will be flickering at the frequency (in Hertz) you specify in the seekbar. By default frequency ranges from 1 to 10Hz.\n\nNote that you can configure the max frequency of 10Hz to the desired value in the Settings view.

Set a specific Altitude height in meters (m) at which you want to get notified by flashlight flickering.

When Altitude is reached, the flashlight will flicker for 15 seconds (default) and the button shall change to the checked one.

Feature is only available if you permit Location rights to @Flashii. If otherwise, the deactivated button is displayed instead.
Altitude specified has been reached. Flashlight will be flickering for 15seconds, unless you deactivate the feature.

Based on your phone's current network connection status, you 'll get notified by flashlight flickering when

a) provider's Network signal, Data or WiFi connection are lost, 

b) provider's Network signal, Data or WiFi are found.
Flickering time after an incoming Call:\nRange from 3s to 180s (default 15s)
